abstract: Venture capital firms raised $1.72 billion in the third quarter, the lowest level since 2003, according to a report released on Monday by Thomson Reuters and the National Venture Capital Association.
snippet: Venture capital firms raised $1.72 billion in the third quarter, the lowest level since 2003, according to a report released on Monday by Thomson Reuters and the National Venture Capital Association.
lead_paragraph: With the market for initial public offerings still on ice and dark clouds looming over the United States economy, the venture capital industry is struggling to raise money.

headline.main: Venture Capital Fund-Raising Tumbles in Third Quarter
